textbooks.title: A Practitioner’s Guide to Software Test Design
textbooks.author: Copeland

grading.policies: Late assignments may be assessed a penalty for each day that the assignment is late – 10% will be deducted for each day your work is late, up to 3 days. No work will be accepted after 3 days beyond the due date.

assignments.description: Weekly recorded video lectures accompanied by lecture materials
Weekly online submissions of individual homework assignments. Some programming will be required for the homework assignments.
Periodic writings (once every 3 weeks) posted to an online shared discussion board - the Tech Blog
Occasional online live meetings or live discussion groups with the professor
Final project for the course that develops a research project related to software engineering.

policies.late_work: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted. Assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must abide by the Stevens Honor System. Plagiarism or other forms of cheating will be dealt with under relevant Stevens policies.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration, recording, editing, and uploading video via Panopto. Required equipment includes a current Mac or PC with high-speed internet connection, webcam, and microphone. Required software includes Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-380-6599.

_metadata.course_description: This course is an in-depth study of software testing and quality throughout the development process.
learning_outcomes: Develop effective test plans and test strategies throughout the system lifecycle
Select best fit test case design methodologies
Prevent system defects and failures through appropriate early defect removal techniques such requirements reviews, code reviews and integration test
Design and implement tests and measure the results
Measure the progress of the testing process
Project the expected reliability and quality of a release
Understand and test for limited security vulnerabilities
Understand and use (limited) automated testing tools
Demonstrate critical thinking by reviewing and critiquing current topics in the field
Understand how software testing fits into the continuous integration and continuous delivery pipeline
Practice learning through lab exercises & team work
